title: Putin blamed as UK factories suffer slowdown; Germany posts first surplus since 1991 - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: tesco ceo dave lewis says he 's `` wonderfully naïve '' about new challenge .
merkel cautious as germany achieves first surplus since 1991
uk factory growth hits 14-month low as geopolitical risks rise .
french factories shrink at fastest rate in 13 months .
italian factory output falls for first time in 13 months .
irish factory pmi hits highest level since 1999

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: time to recap .
britain 's economic recovery has taken a knock after growth across the country 's factories slowed to the slowest rate in 14 months .
manufacturers reported a drop in the growth of output , and new orders .
although overseas demand was still rising , there are signs of a broad-based '' slowdown in the industry .
job creation also slowed .
and the signals from the eurozone have also been disappointing , with france 's factory sector shrinking at a faster pace and italy falling back into contraction .
the uk manufacturing pmi fell to 52.5 in august , a sharp fall on last month 's 54.8 , although still above the 50-point mark that separates expansion from contraction .

uk factory pmi , to august 2014 rob dobson of markit , which compiled the report , warned :  it is also becoming increasingly evident that uk industry is not immune to the impacts of rising geopolitical and global market uncertainty , especially when they affect economic growth and business confidence in our largest trading partner the eurozone .
it is noticeable that where export orders were reported to have risen , companies mainly linked this to demand from north america , asia and the middle east , as opposed to our european partners .

analysts at berenberg bank said the ukraine crisis was clearly hurting britain 's factories , as well as those in the eurozone , saying : russia 's escalation of the conflict in ukraine has taken a toll on the internationally exposed manufacturing sector , and that effect could yet worsen further in the coming months given recent confidence drops in the more directly exposed core european economies .
other economists warned that the uk economy looked less balanced , with consumer credit growing at a faster pace even as factory output slowed .
the eurozone pmis also showed that europe 's economy was slowing , with activity growth hitting a 13-month low .

graeme wearden ( @ graemewearden ) eurozone factory growth hits 13-month low as france and italy struggle in other news germany has posted its first surplus since 1991 , for the first six months of the year .
the news that income outstripped borrowing adds to pressure on berlin to do more to help the rest of europe .

holger sandte , an economist at nordea bank , says : in other european countries the figures will give confirmation to those who expect more fiscal policy impetus from germany , '' but finance minister wolfgang schauble has said that europe needs tighter budget control , rather than a splurge of investment .

over in greece , the government has downplayed hopes of a breakthrough on debt relief when negotiations with its lenders begins tomorrow and the pm has offered the hope of cutting unemployment once its recession finally ends .
the ruble has hit fresh lows as the ukraine crisis rumbled on , and eu leaders consider new sanctions ; a ban on buying russian sovereign debt is one option .
while brazil 's factory has returned to modest growth , while mexico 's has grown at a faster pace .
i 'll be back tomorrow to do it all again goodnight .
gw

documents.title: greece lowers expectations ahead of troika talks
text: tourists rest at filipappou hill opposite of the acropolis during sunset in athens yesterday .

gouliamaki/afp/getty images over in greece , finance minister gikas hardouvelis has been making strenuous efforts to lower expectations around the talks that begin with the country 's creditors in paris on tuesday .

our correspondent in athens , helena smith , reports : gikas hardouvelis emerged from yet another round of strategising insisting that greece would not be giving its troika '' of creditors any red-line ultimatums when negotiations begin in paris on tuesday .
instead , he said , the talks would focus on the plethora of structural reforms athens ' coalition government had implemented over the course of the summer .
the prior actions '' were set as a precondition of greece receiving it next instalment of €1bn in aid .
hardouvelis told reporters : we are not imposing red lines '' .
we have increased the speed of our work .
the fact that we are meeting tomorrow forced us to work all of august and we have moved forward with many structural reforms .
we will mostly discuss them , it will be a wide-ranging discussion .
the bar has been raised .
we have to bear in mind who the counterparties are .
they are members of the international monetary fund , the ( european ) commission , and the european central bank . ''

as such , hardouvelis said , the troika could not impose political decisions ( such as debt relief , for example ) they can only speak about the memorandum , '' hardouvelis , said referring to the loan accord outlining the onerous terms of the financial aid package greece agreed with lenders , adding : you must understand their limits .
they can not speak politically . ''
melissa eddy ( @ meddybln ) germany 's schäuble speaking on the european financial project , cites bill clinton `` it 's integration , stupid . ''

ok , the word on the wires is that the german finance minister is calling for tougher controls of national budgets , effectively enforcing tighter fiscal control across the eurozone : live squawk ( @ livesquawk ) german finmin schaeuble calls for ec powers to block national budgets , says euro region should have its own parliament
or perhaps not cigolo ( @ cigolo ) germany 's schaeuble says too many eu colleagues think that should be corrected with public investments
germany 's finance minister , wolfgang schäuble , appears to be trolling the rest of the eurozone : non-sequitur.co.uk ( @ nonsequiturcouk ) @ minefornothing i know right !
i 'm shouting at livesquawk right now or perhaps he 's just teeing up germany to use its new budget surplus to tackle the problem

documents.title: mexico 's factory sector up pace
text: the final pmi report of the day has just arrived , from mexico , and its factory sector has grown at a faster rate in august .
the mexico manufacturing pmi rose to 52.1 , from the nine-month low of 51.5 recorded in july .
the survey shows that activity up thanks to increased sales volumes , new products , stronger demand from overseas , and increased hiring .
mexico factory pmi , august 2014 markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) our final # pmi result for today : hsbc mexico manufacturing pmi @ 52.1 in august ( jul : 51.5 )
the crisis gripping portugal 's espírito santo conglomerate has taken another twist today .
the wsj reports that goldman sachs lent around $ 835m to banco espírito santo in july , when the troubles of its parent company were already making it hard to access funds .
the cash was earmarked for projects such as a new oil refinery in venezuela .

goldman had planned to make a big profit by selling the loan onto its clients , but ultimately found little appetite for the banco espírito santo 's debt after the scale of its financial problems became clear .
in august , it was bailed out and split into a good bank and bad bank .
chris ( @ lebullmarche ) # goldman loaned $ 835 million to banco espirito santo in july : wsj ouch !

# paintrade # bes # bancoespiritosanto # gs megan murphy ( @ meganmurp ) god works in mysterious ways after all goldman sachs made big loan to banco espírito santo shortly before collapse goldman reportedly sold some of the debt , eventually , at a loss , and is still holding the rest - which is worth less than it paid for it more here : goldman sachs made big loan to banco espírito santo shortly before collapse

mohamed el-erian , chief economic adviser of allianz ( and formally of bond-trading giant pimco ) , agrees that this morning 's eurozone factory data shows the economy weakening : mohamed a. el-erian ( @ elerianm ) this morning 's # pmi data point to weakening growth dynamics in # europe with exception of # greece and # ireland @ twitterid

documents.title: greek pm pledges to cut unemployment
text: greek prime minister antonis samaras , at the end of european leaders extraordinary summit at eu council headquarters on saturday .
hoslet/epa over in greece , the prime minister has vowed to make a dent in the country 's perilously high jobless total .

during a meeting of the government 's employment council on monday , greek prime minister antonis samaras suggested that three quarters of a million new jobs could eb created by the end of the decade .

the kathimerini newspaper reports : unemployment is society 's most insidious and tough enemy because it undermines the dreams of youth , '' samaras said for the first time in 24 quarters there is a projected gdp increase while there is a forecast for new 770,000 jobs by 2020 , '' the conservative premier said .
samaras asked the members of the committee to fine tune their proposals ahead of their next meeting in october .
greece 's jobless rate is currently 27.2 % , more than twice the the eurozone average of 11.6 % .
there are currently around 3.5 million people in work , 1.3 million unemployed , and 3.3 million classed as 'inactive ' ( having dropped out of the labour force altogether ) .
our athens correspondent , helena smith , flags up that samaras has been holding a series of meetings today to hammer out greece 's strategy before meeting its lenders in paris tomorrow .
he used last weekend 's eu summer to push european commission president-elect jean-claude juncker over the issue of debt relief for greece .

documents.title: brazil 's factory sector posts modest growth after world cup disruption
text: another pmi report just landed , showing that brazil 's factory sector has returned to ( modest ) growth last month .
brazilian manufacturing pmi broke over the 50-point mark , which splits expansion from contraction , for the first time since march , rising to 50.2 from 49.1 in july .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) hsbc brazil manufacturing # pmi posts 50.2 in august , ( jul : 49.1 ) .
although marginal , first > 50.0 reading in 5 months .
that 's encouraging , given brazil slipped into recession in the last quarter .
hsbc , which compiled the report , suggests that brazil 's economy may have returned to normal after the disruption of the world cup .

but the economy still looks troubled : andre loes , chief economist for brazil at hsbc , says : the hsbc brazil manufacturing pmi index suggests that business activity improved modestly in august in what may have been a rebound following the disruptions caused by the fifa world cup .
the headline pmi index rose from 49.1 in july to 50.2 in august - the first above-50 reading since march , on the back of a sizeable rebound in production .
however , new orders remain flat relative to the last month , suggesting that the outlook for the sector remains weak . ''
brazilian factory pmi , august 2014 /markit

documents.title: european markets dip
text: the slowdown in eurozone manufacturing growth has helped to push the main european markets into the red , on a generally tedious trading session .
the italian stock market is down almost 0.5 % , after its factories reported an unwelcome drop in activity .
france 's cac index is in the red too , while the german and uk markets are hovering .
and the early rally on the moscow stock market has evaporated after rumours emerged that eu leaders are considering banning europeans from buying russian sovereign debt .
european stock markets , 2pm , september 1 2014 reuters

analysts at m & g 's bond vigilantes arm point out that germany has reached a surplus despite weak growth in the last six months : bond vigilantes ( @ bondvigilantes ) germany had 1st budget surplus in h1 since 1991 , despite gdp growth of just 0.5 % .
note to uk- that is austerity
there 's also chatter that the new sanctions on russia could hit its high-tech gas supply industry .
mike bergen ( @ bergencapital ) `` @ cigolo : ban on buying russian bonds eyed as eu envoys meet-sources high technology for gas excavation also under consideration ''
interesting eu leaders are going to consider a ban on europeans buying russian government bonds , according to a reuters newswire snap .
barnejek ( @ barnejek ) rtrs - ban on europeans buying russian government bonds to be discussed at eu talks on further sanctions - sources woof woof
a reminder of how labour 's share of the pie has been nibbled away since the post-war days : jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) `` happy '' labor day america .
rt @ twitterid : graph : the decline of wages as a share of us gdp

documents.title: tesco ceo dave lewis says he 's `` wonderfully naïve '' about new challenge
text: hats off to james ashton , executive editor at the evening standard and the independent , for bagging the first interview with tesco 's new boss , dave lewis .
lewis , who started at tesco this morning , mainly focuses on his work at unilever ( launching dove in the uk , making shampoo more glamorous , etc ) , but there 's a few hints about his style .
here 's a flavour : how can i help you ? ''
he shoots across the table , pleasantries aside .
no wonder lewis has a reputation for putting the customer first .
he is slick , but later comes a confession .
i am wonderfully naïve about some of the stuff that is going to come but that is fine , it has served me well up to now , '' he says , vowels flat from his yorkshire upbringing .
i will do what i have to do tomorrow in the same way that i did things yesterday . ''
lewis concedes that he 's never done anything quite like this before ; indeed , that 's the attraction : i needed to find out for myself whether i can lead a whole business , '' lewis says .
some people think that is crazy given some of the jobs i have done but actually i do n't think you know whether you can truly lead a business until you sit in that seat . ''
james ashton ( @ mrjamesashton ) it 's day one for tesco 's dave lewis .
read the first interview here tesco shares are still down 1.6 % today , after major shareholder harris associates confirmed it had cut its stake ( details here )

documents.title: merkel cautious as germany achieves first surplus since 1991
text: back to germany , and the eurozone 's largest economy has officially posted its first surplus since reunification , for the first six months of this year .
the federal statistical office , destatis , reported that germany 's general government achieved a surplus of €16.1bn in january-june , or around +1.1 % of gdp .
that 's the combined spending and borrowing of central government , state government , local government and social security funds .
destatis said that germany 's general government has benefited from a very good employment situation '' .
here 's the details : germany 's central government achieved a surplus of €4bn , for the first time since 1991 .
state government borrowed €200m .
local government had a surplus of €5.3bn and the social security funds enjoy a surplus of €7.1bn this result surely puts more pressure on berlin to boost spending to help the rest of the eurozone .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) it 's official , germany had its first gg surplus ( +1.1 % gdp ) in 23 years .
there must be some room for flexibility .

angela merkel , though , has declared that any additional spending would be aimed at 'investment ' : the german chancellor told a news conference this morning that : first we have to see if the economic forecasts remain as they are .
if we have more money , if in doubt we will spend it in the area of investment . ''
it is absolutely right for the topic of investment to be so prominent . ''
( quotes via reuters )

documents.title: ruble hits new lows as ukraine crisis continues
text: the escalating dispute between russia and ukraine has also driven the ruble down to a fresh record low today .
a bout of early selling pushed the ruble down by around 1 % , so that $ 1 was now worth 37.6 rubles .
the prospect of further economic sanctions being imposed on russia within days also hit the country 's government bonds , although the moscow stock market is up 0.8 % today .
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) ruble falls to record , 10yr yield jumps to highest in 5years as # russia sanctions loom .
over the weekend , german chancellor angela merkel said europe would announce new sanctions within the week , unless russia scaled back its intervention in ukraine .
but rather than pulling back , vladimir putin suggested yesterday that discussions on statehood '' for the south-east regions of ukraine should begin .

that has left the city watching events nervously again , as marc ostwald of adm investor services explains : developments in the ukraine will eminently also continue to cast a long shadow , and will obviously be the main topic for discussion at this week 's nato summit in the uk , with the weekend call from some us senators to arm the ukraine '' and putin 's call for an independent state in the ukraine underlining alarming similarities to the antecedents to world war i .
today 's weak manufacturing data , though , may dampen enthusiasm for new sanctions on russia , as they are likely to hurt europe 's economy too .
martin beck , senior economic advisor to the ey item club , also fears that britain 's economy is becoming more unbalanced .

he 's worried by the august factory slowdown , and the jump in unsecured lending to consumers in july ( see here ) , saying : the combination of today 's data suggests that the uk 's expansion is in danger of losing its balance .
in early 2014 , investment and exports offered solid support to gdp growth and reduced the economy 's reliance on consumer spending and the housing sector .
but there is now concern that the uk is in danger of repeating the problems of the past .
we should remember that britain 's factory sector has been declining as a proportion of the overall economy for decades .
this chart , from bloomberg 's uk economist1 jamie murray , shows how overall uk gdp has grown much faster than the manufacturing sector since the mid 1970s .
jamie murray ( @ jmurray804 ) @ graemewearden stable gdp share optimistic for a sector that has lost average of 29000 jobs every quarter since 1978
the no .
5 blast furnace at corus 's port talbot works , in wales .

/ newscast/epa/corbis and here 's some full reaction from jeremy cook , world first 's chief economist , to the uk factory slowdown : while growth has remained positive , manufacturing is now expanding at the slowest rate since june of last year .
output and new orders for uk manufactured goods continued positively , but the slowing of growth has meant that employment change is at its weakest in 14 months .
all of this points to a rather broad slowdown in british industry , an entirely warranted hangover from the giddy highs that the sector hit in the early part of the year .
confidence in export markets has slipped in the past month as well , as talk of trade sanctions and a general slowing of global economic momentum has taken its toll .
while the worst days of the recession are definitely behind us , this survey also suggests that the finest days of the recovery are too .
gains are going to be a lot more hard-fought . ''
here 's a news story on the slowdown in britain 's factories : uk manufacturing pmi hits 14-month low in august
in other british economic news , the number of mortgages being approved has fallen .
just 66,569 new home loans were approved in july , down from 67,085 in june .
that suggests the market is cooling somewhat as recent affordability tests hit home .
unsecured lending rose , though , as showing an increase in demand for credit .
uk mortgage approvals , to august 2014 of england mortgages approvals were running at 90,000 per month before the financial crisis struck in 2008 , and recently peaked at around 77,000 in january

documents.title: berenberg : putin hits uk manufacturing
text: rob wood of berenberg bank lays the blame for britain 's factory slowdown firmly at the feet of vladimir putin .
wood warns that the escalating tensions with ukraine could hurt uk growth this year , and in 2015 .
he writes : putin hits uk manufacturing .
the manufacturing pmi fell sharply to a 14 month low of 52.5 , down from 55.4 in july and below consensus expectations .

russia 's escalation of the conflict in ukraine has taken a toll on the internationally exposed manufacturing sector , and that effect could yet worsen further in the coming months given recent confidence drops in the more directly exposed core european economies .
these developments pose a serious downside risk to growth this year and next .
wood adds that uk consumers are not ( yet ) alarmed by geopolitics , with confidence buoyant last month .
so far then increased international uncertainty is probably affecting exports and investment plans the most , and could return the uk to the lopsided consumer led recovery seen last year .

mike rigby , head of manufacturing at barclays , says today 's pmi survey shows uk factories have n't achieved faster export growth : growth in manufacturing continues but at a more controlled level than we have seen so far this year .
although there is still a confident buzz amongst manufacturers , the fragility of a recovery which continues to rely heavily on consumer spending is still an underlying cause for concern .
a much-needed boost in export orders is yet to materialise but is becoming increasingly important if the uk manufacturing recovery is to rebalance and become more sustainable . ''

documents.title: cips : britain 's factories are slowing
text: david noble , ceo of the chartered institute of purchasing & supply , agrees that this morning 's pmi report shows the uk factory sector is slowing .
uk manufacturers were walking rather than running in august as the sector 's performance fell to a 14-month low and growth began to slow further .
there is a distinct easing across the breadth of uk manufacturing , with growth in output , new orders and employment all reducing to a more pedestrian level . ''

and noble pins the blame on escalating tensions with russia , and the weak euro economy : growth in new export orders has slowed to a five- month low against a backdrop of market uncertainty and increasing geo-political tensions .
to help plug the hole left by a faltering eurozone , manufacturers are finding new markets in north america and the middle east .

vitally however , manufacturers continue to anticipate growth for the foreseeable future , with smes in particular , still hiring to catch up with one and a half years of consecutive output and new order growth .
noble also suggests that the new 'status quo ' is that britain 's manufacturing sector will stabilise at a smaller proportion of gdp than before the recession '' .
if he 's right , then the service sector would be even more dominant than before , despite talk of rebalancing the uk .

jeremy cook , economist at world first , fears that the recent revival in britain 's factory sector may have run its course : world first ( @ world first ) while the worst days of the recession are definitely behind us , uk pmi survey also suggests that the finest days of the recovery are too

documents.title: uk factory growth hits 14-month low as geopolitical risks rise
text: there is bad news in the uk too - britain 's factory sector has reported a bigger than expected drop in growth last month .
geopolitical tensions , such as the ukraine crisis , appear to be hitting growth in the sector after a strong performance over the last year .
europe 's economic malaise is also hurting manufacturers .
the uk manufacturing pmi fell to 52.5 in august , a sharp fall on last month 's 54.8 , and the weakest growth since june 2013 .

uk manufacturing pmi , august 2014 markit , which compiled the report , says a broad slowdown '' is underway in britain 's manufacturing sector , with inflow of new business and new export orders weakening and the pace of job creation also easing .

economist rob dobson explains : it is also becoming increasingly evident that uk industry is not immune to the impacts of rising geopolitical and global market uncertainty , especially when they affect economic growth and business confidence in our largest trading partner the eurozone .
it is noticeable that where export orders were reported to have risen , companies mainly linked this to demand from north america , asia and the middle east , as opposed to our european partners .
it therefore looks as if manufacturing will provide a lesser contribution to the uk economic growth story in the third quarter than at the start of the year .
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) another sign that the uk economic boom is fading as the august manufacturing # pmi falls to 52.5 # gbp more reaction to follow
some early reaction to the news that eurozone factory growth slowed last month : yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) another bad day for # euro zone econ data , # germany slowing down too .
pressure on # ecb mounts .
gavin hewitt ( @ bbcgavinhewitt ) overall of manufacturing in eurozone : activity slowing - although some growth , prices hardly increasing .
ukraine a factor # eurozone

documents.title: eurozone factory growth hits 13-month low
text: eurozone pmi , august 2014 and the upshot of all this morning 's data is that the eurozone 's manufacturing sector has just recorded its weakest growth in 13 months , adding to pressure on policymakers to take more action .
the weakness of the euro economy hit europe 's factories hard last month , with new orders and new export growth slowing .
as covered already , france was the main laggard , with its pmi signalling the sharpest rate of decline since may 2013 .
italy dropped back into contraction territory , while spain and germany both saw slowing growth .
ireland , where the pmi hit a 15-year high , was a rare highlight .
the overall eurozone pmi , tracking activity across the single currency region , fell to just 50.7 from 51.8 in july , closer to the 50-point of stagnation .
and the number of people employed across the manufacturing sector fell , although it was a mixed the big-three nations of germany , france and italy all reported job losses , as did greece .
staffing rose in spain , the netherlands , austria and ireland , but ireland was the only nation to report a faster pace of hiring than in july .

eurozone manufacturing pmi , to august 2014 rob dobson of markit says the report will intensify the pressure on the european central bank , which meets this week :  national data provided some bright spots , with the irish numbers still buoyant and signs that greece managed to move back into expansion territory .
france remains a real concern though , with its manufacturing sector contracting at the quickest pace since may 2013 , as does italy 's descent from solid expansion to stagnation .
signs that growth impetus waned in the key industrial engine of germany , and in spain and the netherlands too , is also less than reassuring .
the slowdown in industry is likely to add further fuel to the fire for analysts expecting additional monetary or fiscal stimulus to be implemented .
eyes will now turn to the services pmi numbers on wednesday for further clues on underlying growth momentum and whether policymakers can continue to wait for earlier measures to start to deliver .
reaction to follow
better news from greece ; factories have reported their first growth since may , with the pmi inching over the 50-point mark .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) greek manufacturing output returns to growth in august , headline # pmi at 50.1 ( 48.7 in july )

documents.title: germany : `` warning lights '' flashing as pmi falls
text: german factory sector has grown at its slowest rate in 11 months , with its manufacturing pmi dipping to 51.4 from 52.4 in july .
markit economist oliver kolodseike warns that : warning lights are flashing in germany 's goods-producing sector , ''

documents.title: french factories shrink at fastest rate in 13 months
text: the decline in france 's factory sector has accelerated , as europe 's second largest economy still struggles .
the french manufacturing pmi has slipped to just 46.9 , well below the 50-point mark that separates expansion from contraction .
that 's the lowest reading in 13 months .
new orders and employment levels both shrank at a faster pace , suggesting the manufacturing sector lost more ground .

french pmi , final , august 2014 jack kennedy , senior economist at markit , says : the latest disappointing pmi data for france 's manufacturing sector underline its ongoing struggles , with new orders sinking further in a fragile demand environment .
sharply falling output led firms to cut back employment , purchasing and stock levels further in august .
this sort of across- the-board weakness has been a common theme in recent months and there remains very little to suggest any turnaround in fortunes will be imminent . ''
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) and the beat goes on in # france as its manufacturing # pmi falls to 46.9 in august # euro

documents.title: italian factory output falls for first time in 13 months
text: bad news from italy .
its factory sector has suffered its first drop in activity in over a year .
the italian manufacturing pmi fell to 49.8 in august , down from 51.9 in july .
it 's the first time since june 2013 that the index has fallen below the 50-point mark .
markit , which compiles the report , found that firms cut staff last month as new orders slowed .
it 's a worrying signal from the eurozone 's third largest economy , which has already fallen back into recession .
jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) italian manufacturing sector contracts for first time in over a year .
pmi falls to 49.8 in aug from 51.9 in july , expected 50.8 .
as flagged in the intro , germany 's federal statistics office has confirmed that its economy contracted by 0.2 % in the second quarter of this year .
that matches the first estimate of gdp , released last month .
today 's report is more detailed , and shows that investment in the construction sector shrank by 4.2 % .
gross capital formation '' , the wider measure of investment , fell 0.2 % .
edward hugh ( @ edward hugh ) german gdp slump largely construction .
net trade also a drag .
big inventory build-up .
outlook weak .
back to those pmi reports and the dutch manufacturing sector has grown at its slowest rate in over a year .
the netherlands manufacturing pmi dipped to 51.7 , from 53.3 in july .
that still shows that activity expanded , but rather less vigorously .
output , new orders , and employment growth all slowed .

documents.title: tesco shares slide after investor cuts stake
text: shares in tesco have fallen by over 1.5 % this morning as the city gives new chief executive dave lewis a cautious reception .
lewis has been rushed into the supermarket to take charge a month early , after last friday 's nasty profits warning .
over the weekend , it emerged that one of tesco 's largest shareholders , harris associates , had halved its 3 % stake .
harris blamed unclear management direction and incoherent strategy '' , given tesco will have both a new ceo and chief financial officer ( having lured alan stewart from marks & spencer ) .

michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) spain manufacturing pmi ( aug ) comes in weaker than expected at 52.8 , exp 53.3 frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) spanish manuf pmi - input prices still rising , but output prices down to a 5-month low ( 48.8 ) .

documents.title: spanish factories expand again , but at slower pace
text: onto spain , and its factory sector has just recorded its ninth expansion in a row .
growth has slowed , though , with markit 's manufacturing pmi dropping to 52.8 from 53.9 in july .
that 's still a fairly decent rate of expansion , given weakness in other parts of the eurozone , although slower than expected .
encouragingly , firms reported that they took on more staff to deal with rising demand .
however , some companies also reported that they 'd cut prices to secure sales in a number of cases .
that suggests client demand remains fragile , says andrew harker of markit .

markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) spain 's manufacturing expansion slows in august , with the headline # pmi at 52.8 ( july : 53.9 ) markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) however , mfg orders in spain rose at quickest pace in +7 years .
charted against quantity of purchases index here :

documents.title: russia 's pmi holds steady
text: russia 's manufacturing sector has posted a small rise in activity last month , with its manufacturing pmi unchanged at 51.0 .
president putin 's recent policy of import substitution '' ( encouraging firms to use domestic products rather than overseas goods ) appears to be stimulating activity .
new orders rose at the fastest pace in a year .

here 's the key points : russian factory pmi , to august 2014 reuters alexander morozov , hsbc 's chief economist for russia , is cautious : the overall impact of import substitution on the russian economy appears to be negative .
indeed , large scale import substitution ty leads to higher costs and output prices growth , deducting from private consumption more than manufacturers add on the production side .
taiwan has posted the strongest pmi report this morning , with new factory orders rising at the fastest rate in 42 months .

but indonesia 's manufacturing sector contracted for the first time in a year : markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) taiwan tops the asian manufacturing # pmi table for the third month running in august

documents.title: irish factory pmi hits highest level since 1999
text: ireland 's factories have just expanded at their fastest rate in 15 years , helped by a big jump in new orders from britain .
the latest purchasing managers survey , which is produced by investec , found a marked improvement in the health of the irish manufacturing sector '' , with output and new orders both accelerating .
this pushed the investec purchasing managers ' index , which gives a measure of the sector 's health , up to 57.3 in august from 55.4 in the previous month .
that signalled the sharpest monthly improvement in operating conditions since december 1999 '' .
irish manufacturing pmi , august 2014 the report suggests that ireland 's economy is making progress since the country exited its bailout at the end of last year .
demand from the uk helped to push export orders higher , which prompted firms to increase their staffing levels sharply during august .

philip o'sullivan , chief economist at investec ireland , predicted that the irish recovery would continue : this is a strong outcome , particularly when framed against the backdrop of weakening signs from some eurozone trading partners of late , although the prognosis for ireland 's other key export markets ( the us and uk ) remains encouraging .

with manufacturing firms in ireland stepping up their purchasing and hiring activity , it is clear that they are optimistic of a strong finish to the year and , while noting that the risks to global growth and ( not unrelated ) geopolitical tensions have increased in recent months , we expect to see continued progress into 2015 . ''

documents.title: china factory growth slows
text: there are new fears that china 's factory sector is slowing , after two surveys of the country 's manufacturers came in weaker than expected .
hsbc 's monthly china manufacturing survey has found that output and new order growth slowed last month , as firms continued to shed job .

the survey found that : weaker expansions of both output and new orders recorded job shedding intensifies input costs decline for the first time since may that pulled the pmi down to just 50.2 , close to stagnation .
chinese factory pmi , to august 2014 hsbc economist hongbin qu warned domestic demand in china looks subdued , although external demand did improve .
overall , the manufacturing sector still expanded in august , but at a slower pace compared to previous months .
we think the economy still faces considerable downside risks to growth in the second half of the year , which warrant further policy easing to ensure a steady growth recovery . ''
china 's government released its own pmi report this morning , which focuses on larger state-supported factories .
and that also showed a slowdown , to 51.1 from 51.7 .

it also found that factories have now been shedding jobs for the last two years the survey also showed that output , employment , new orders , delivery time and raw material inventory all fell across the board .

documents.title: pmi reports to show how eurozone performed in august
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world , economy , the eurozone and business .
we 're starting the week with a splurge of economic surveys of manufacturing sectors across the globe .
the latest purchasing managers indexes from european countries for august will be closely watched , as the eurozone crisis has flared up again in recent weeks .
these surveys indicate whether a sector expanded or shrank last month ( yes , it 's september ) .
any reading of 50 points or more suggests growth , while sub-50 indicates a contraction .
updated german growth data is being released this morning , confirming that its economy suffered a 0.2 % drop in gdp in april-june .
analysts are combing through the details now .
we 'll be keeping tabs on greece , ahead of the talks with its lenders which begin in paris tomorrow .
but traders do n't expect much drama in the stock markets today , particularly as it 's the us labor day holiday .
peter hoskins ( @ peterhoskinssky ) something of a tumbleweed open seen for share markets as september trading gets underway .
financial bookies : ftse100 +1 , dax flat , cac40 +2
